claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

verified_evidence.quote: Flublok [Influenza Vaccine] is a sterile clear colorless injection containing recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three influenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains purified HA proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived from Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frugiperda (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography. The purified HAs are then blended and filled into single dose syringes.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that Flublok is produced using a novel production platform where recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells (derived from Sf9 cells of Spodoptera frugiperda) using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS), specifically mentioning the use of a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus). This matches all elements of the claim without requiring inference.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears in the document, though with minor formatting and wording differences due to OCR correction. The relevant section is: 'Flublok [Influenza Vaccine] is a sterile clear colorless injection containing recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three influenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains purified HA proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived from Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frugiperda (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography. The purified HAs are then blended and filled into single dose syringes.' This matches the quote to verify, with only minor differences in punctuation and line breaks.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that Flublok is produced using a novel production platform where recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells (derived from Sf9 cells of Spodoptera frugiperda) using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS), specifically mentioning the use of a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus). This matches all elements of the claim without requiring inference.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote explicitly describes the production platform for Flublok, stating that recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS), which directly supports the claim.

verified_evidence.quote: Flublok contains no egg proteins, antibiotics, or preservatives. The single dose, pre filled syringes contain no natural rubber latex. Each 0.5 mL dose of Flublok may also contain residual amounts of baculovirus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins (≤14.3 mcg), baculovirus and cellular DNA (≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg).
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote provides specific evidence that Flublok contains residual amounts of baculovirus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins, which directly supports the claim that Flublok is produced using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS) in insect cells. The mention of Spodoptera frugiperda (the fall armyworm, an insect) and baculovirus confirms the use of insect cells and baculovirus in the production process. Therefore, the quote genuinely supports the claim about the novel production platform.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears in the document, specifically in the following passage: 'Flublok contains recombinant HA proteins of the three strains of influenza virus specified by health authorities for inclusion in the annual seasonal vaccine. ... Each 0.5 mL dose of Flublok may also contain residual amounts of baculo virus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins (≤14.3 mcg), baculo virus and cellular DNA (≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg). Flublok contains no egg proteins, antibiotics, or preservatives. The single dose, pre filled syringes contain no natural rubber latex.' The factual content, numbers, and technical details match the quote to verify.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote provides specific evidence that Flublok contains residual amounts of baculovirus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins, which directly supports the claim that Flublok is produced using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS) in insect cells. The mention of Spodoptera frugiperda (the fall armyworm, an insect) and baculovirus confirms the use of insect cells and baculovirus in the production process. Therefore, the quote genuinely supports the claim about the novel production platform.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote provides further evidence that Flublok is produced using a baculovirus expression system in insect cells (Spodoptera frugiperda), as it mentions residual amounts of baculovirus and insect cell proteins, supporting the claim about the novel production platform.

verified_evidence.quote: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements. For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains... Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that each of the three hemagglutinin (HA) proteins in Flublok is expressed in an insect cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), which is the core of the baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS) platform. This confirms that Flublok is produced using a novel production platform involving recombinant HA expression in insect cells via BEVS, as claimed.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears in the document, though with minor formatting and wording differences. Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography.' This confirms that Flublok is produced using a novel production platform involving recombinant HA expression in insect cells via BEVS, as claimed.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote reiterates that the hemagglutinin proteins in Flublok are produced by expressing them in insect cells using a baculovirus vector, which is the core of the BEVS platform, directly affirming the claim.

verified_evidence.quote: 5. Treanor JJ, Schiff GM, Hayden FG, et.al. Safety and immunogenicity of a baculovirus expressed hemagglutinin influenza vaccine: a randomized controlled trial. JAMA. 2007 Vol. 297, pp. 1577-1582.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly describes the referenced vaccine as a 'baculovirus expressed hemagglutinin influenza vaccine.' This explicitly supports the claim that Flublok is produced using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS) to express recombinant HA. The reference is used in the context of Flublok's clinical studies and supports the technical details of the claim.
